intro: Corydalis bosbutooensis, commonly known as the Bosbutoo lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
